required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cefprozil 500 mg Tablets Under Fasting Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: A Relative Bioavailability Study of Cefprozil 500 mg Tablets Under Fasting Conditions

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to compare the relative bioavailability of cefprozil 500 mg tablets (Teva Pharmaceuticals USA) with that of Cefzil® 500 mg tablets (Bristol-Myers Squibb) in healthy, non-smoking adults under fasting conditions.

detailed_description.textblock:
Criteria for Evaluation: FDA Bioequivalence Criteria
Statistical Methods: FDA bioequivalence statistical methods

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples collected over a 12 hour period.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-t (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Time of Last Measurable Concentration)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples collected over a 12 hour period.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-inf (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples collected over a 12 hour period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects selected for this study will be non-smokers at least 18 years of age. Subjects will have a BMI (body mass index) of 30 or less.
- Each subject shall be given a general physical examination within 28 days of initiation of the study. Such examination includes, but is not limited to, blood pressure, general observations, and history.
- Each female subject will be given a serum pregnancy test as part of the pre-study screening process.
- At the end of the study, the subjects will have an exit evaluation consisting of interim history, global evaluation, and clinical laboratory measurements.
- Adequate blood and urine samples should be obtained within 28 days before beginning of the first period and at the end of the trial for clinical laboratory measurements.
- Clinical laboratory measurements will include the following.
- HEMATOLOGY: hematocrit, hemoglobin, WBC count with differential, RBC count, platelet count
- CLINICAL CHEMISTRY: creatinine, BUN, glucose, SGOT/AST, SGPT/ALT, bilirubin, and alkaline phosphatase
- HIV antibody, hepatitis B surface antigen, hepatitis C antibody screens
- URINE ANALYSIS: pH, specific gravity, protein, glucose, ketones, bilirubin, occult blood, and cells
- Drugs of Abuse Screen
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a significant recent history of chronic alcohol consumption (past 2 years), drug addiction, or serious gastrointestinal, renal, hepatic or cardiovascular disease, tuberculosis, epilepsy, asthma (past 5 years), diabetes, psychosis or glaucoma will not be eligible for this study.
- Subjects whose clinical laboratory test values are greater than 20% outside the normal range may be retested. If the clinical values are outside the range on retesting, subjects will not be eligible to participate in the study unless the clinical investigator deems the results to not be significant.
- Subjects who have a history of allergic responses to the class of drug being tested will be excluded from the study.
- Subjects who use tobacco in any form will not be eligible to participate in the study. Three months abstinence is required.
- All subjects will have urine samples assayed for the presence of drugs of abuse as part of the clinical laboratory screening procedures and at each dosing period check-in. Subjects found to have urine concentrations of any of the tested drugs will not be allowed to participate.
- Subjects should not have donated blood and/or plasma for at least thirty (30) days prior to the first dosing of the study.
- Subjects who have taken any investigational drug within thirty (30) days prior to the first dosing of the study will not be allowed to participate.
- Female subjects who are pregnant, breast-feeding, or who are likely to become pregnant during the study will not be allowed to participate. Female subjects of child bearing potential must either abstain froom sexual intercourse or use a reliable barrier method (e.g. condom, IUD) of contraception during the course of the study (first dosing until last blood collection) or they will not be allowed to participate. Female subjects who have used hormonal oral contraceptives within 14 days of dosing or implanted or injected hormonal contraceptives within 180 days of dosing will not be allowed to participate.
- All female subjects will be screened for pregnancy at check-in each study period. Subjects with positive or inconclusive results will be withdrawn from the study.
- Subjects who do not tolerate venipuncture will not be allowed to participate.

group.title: Cefprozil (Test) First
group.description: 500 mg Cefprozil Tablets test product dosed in first period followed by 500 mg Cefzil® Tablets reference product dosed in the second period.

group.title: Cefzil® (Reference) First
group.description: 500 mg Cefzil® Tablets reference product dosed in first period followed by 500 mg Cefprozil Tablets test product dosed in the second period.

group.title: Cefprozil (Test) First
group.description: 500 mg Cefprozil Tablets test product dosed in first period followed by 500 mg Cefzil® Tablets reference product dosed in the second period.

group.title: Cefzil® (Reference) First
group.description: 500 mg Cefzil® Tablets reference product dosed in first period followed by 500 mg Cefprozil Tablets test product dosed in the second period.

outcome.title: Cmax (Maximum Observed Concentration)
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples collected over a 12 hour period.
outcome.population: All participants that completed the study had their samples analyzed.

group.title: Cefprozil (Test)
group.description: 500 mg Cefprozil Tablets test product dosed in either period.

group.title: Cefzil® (Reference)
group.description: 500 mg Cefzil® Tablets reference product dosed in either period.

measure.title: Cmax (Maximum Observed Concentration)
measure.population: All participants that completed the study had their samples analyzed.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The ANOVA model containing factors for sequence of products, subjects within sequence, periods, and products was utilized in comparing the effects between the test and reference products. Differences were declared statistically significant at the 5% level (p<0.05).
analysis.param_type: Ratio of the T/R geometric mean x 100
analysis.estimate_desc: Bioequivalence is established if the 90% confidence interval for the ln-transformed geometric mean between the reference and test product fall within the interval of 80-125%

outcome.title: AUC0-t (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Time of Last Measurable Concentration)
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples collected over a 12 hour period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Principal Investigator is not permitted to discuss or publish trial results.
